question_sentence: What is the name of the US envoy for climate who announced a Cop26 deal with China to cooperate on carbon emissions?
evidence: In a joint declaration at the climate summit in Glasgow, the two  rival nations pledged to ‘recall their firm commitment to work together’ to achieve the aims of the 2015 Paris Climate Agreement

question_sentence: Three MPs were accused of disrespecting the Armed Forces by getting drunk on a flight to join troops for Armistice Day commemorations in which overseas terrority?
evidence: A witness told The Sun that the trio, named as Labour MP Charlotte Nichols and SNP lawmakers David Linden and Drew Hendry, had ‘looked like they were going on a stag do’

question_sentence: More than 250 specialist rescuers helped to free an injured man  trapped underground for two days in a cave in which mountain range?
evidence: The unnamed man, described as an ‘experienced caver’, broke his jaw and suffered leg and spinal injuries when he fell while caving in Ogof Ffynnon Ddu near Penwyllt, a hamlet 20 miles northeast of Swansea in Wales

question_sentence: At least nine people were confirmed to have died as a result of a crowd surge at a concert by rapper Travis Scott in which US state?
evidence: At least two festivalgoers have launched lawsuits against the Grammy-nominated musician amid allegations that he ‘incited’ the crowd while performing at the Astroworld show in Houston

question_sentence: How many MPs were revealed by The Independent to have claimed taxpayer cash to pay rental costs while earning money letting out their own properties?
evidence: Two Labour lawmakers and 15 Tories reportedly claimed a total of £1.3m over five years by using a loophole that allows MPs to claim rent on their parliamentary expenses even if they already own a home in London

question_sentence: Latest official figures show that which continent now accounts for more than half of all new Covid-19 infections reported worldwide?
evidence: The spike is being driven by an increase in infections in Eastern Europe, where many countries have among the world’s lowest vaccination rates

question_sentence: How many UK companies have relocated to Estonia since Brexit, according to the EU member state?
evidence: Prime Minister Kaja Kallas told City A.M. that her country is now host to seven so-called ‘unicorn’ companies – technology firms with a market value of more than $1bn

question_sentence: Production issues have caused shortages of which popular snacks in the UK?
evidence: Walkers bosses have been forced to reduce production at the company’s factory in Leicester, owing to disruption caused by a computer glitch during a recent IT system upgrade

question_sentence: Northern Ireland’s health minister is suing which musician over a Covid-related chant?
evidence: Robin Swann has initiated legal proceedings after the singer chanted that his handling of the pandemic had been ‘very dangerous’, during an anti-lockdown rant at a Belfast gig that was cancelled at the last minute

question_sentence: Turkey has threatened to deport Syrian refugees over videos posted on social media showing them eating which fruit?
evidence: Turkish authorities have accused the Syrians of ‘inciting hatred’ by eating bananas in a ‘provocative’ way. Find out more with The Week Unwrapped podcast

question_sentence: Investigations continue into the deadly crowd surge at the Astroworld Festival in Houston. Which musical artist organized the festival and was performing at the time of the tragedy?
evidence: The Astroworld Festival featured rapper Travis Scott – also the festival’s organizer – who, along with other entities, now faces dozens of lawsuits over the incident that involved 50,000 fans and led to 8 deaths.

question_sentence: The world has seen 250 million reported Covid-19 infections. Together, the US, India and which other country have made up 40% of global cases?
evidence: The US, India and Brazil account for 40% of the global Covid-19 cases. The US is at the top with nearly 46.5 million cases reported.

question_sentence: What unusual event recently caused a New Zealand cricket match to be suspended?
evidence: A cricket match between Canterbury and Wellington, New Zealand was suspended due to a swarm of bees taking over the pitch, with play ultimately continuing the following day.

question_sentence: Speaking at the COP26 summit, which notable figure admonished former President Donald Trump for “four years of active hostility towards climate science?”
choices: New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern
Special Presidential Envoy for Climate John Kerry
evidence: Former US President Barack Obama spoke against his successor and other persons in power, including taking direct aim at Chinese President Xi Jinping and Russian President Vladimir Putin for skipping the COP26 entirely.

question_sentence: In a deal brokered by the Biden administration, which vaccine will be distributed via COVAX, a global Covid-19 vaccine distribution program, to people in conflict zones and other hard-to-reach areas in need?
evidence: COVAX will partner with Johnson & Johnson to issue its easily distributed, single-dose vaccine to conflict zones and humanitarian situations around the world.

question_sentence: Tensions between these two Eastern European countries are at risk of boiling over due to disputes over the movement of displaced migrants.
evidence: Fueled by misinformation and the machinations of various state actors, tensions are on the rise as thousands of migrants – facing brutally harsh winter conditions and terrain – are attempting to cross the border from Belarus into Poland.

question_sentence: FW de Klerk died this week at the age of 85. He was a former leader and Nobel Laureate from which country?
evidence: De Klerk, the last leader of apartheid South Africa, freed his eventual successor Nelson Mandela from prison. The two men shared the Nobel Peace Prize in 1993.

question_sentence: A giant working joystick recently nabbed a Guinness World Record for being the largest of its kind. How big is it?
evidence: The 9-foot-tall video game joystick – 14 times the size of a classic Atari CX40 controller – has to be taken apart by two cranes.

question_sentence: Who is People Magazine’s deemed the ‘Sexiest Man Alive’ for 2021?
evidence: Revealed in a comedy sketch on “The Late Show with Stephen Colbert,” Paul Rudd has received the honor of this year’s Sexiest Man Alive from People Magazine.

question_sentence: What is Mariah Carey giving away for free this holiday season, all inspired by some of her “favorite memories” with her kids?
evidence: Mariah Carey, in partnership with McDonald’s, will be giving away free fast-food items throughout the holidays, asall part of her “Mariah Menu” set to debut next month.
